Here are just a few reasons why the hoax nonsense never caught on. First of 
all, nobody is trying to "prove" this event happened or didn't happen 
because it's not up for debate. There are scores of real, live eyewitnesses 
who were there and saw and heard the shooting happening. There are 26 
families (parents, spouses, children, siblings...etc) that lost a loved one 
in the shooting who are out and about in public, before AND after the 
shooting. There was an official investigation which yielded an official 
peer reviewed report , based on corroborated eyewitness testimony, actual, 
physical, forensic and DNA evidence. Of course there are anomalies and 
inconsistencies after the fact, there are with every large scale event, but 
especially with something of this scale, this gruesome and with absolutely 
no precedent. Human beings were witnessing and processing an event of 
unthinkable horror. If anything, anomalies and inconsistencies only serve 
to further validate the official story. Or should we talk about how it 
would be completely impossible to pull off a scripted, fictitious scenario 
of this size and complexity, with so many moving parts, and god knows how 
many men, women, children, organizations, agencies...etc that would have to 
be involved and then, after nearly 3 years - every single one remains 
airtight and silent. REALLY?...oh, and for what? To pass a law? REALLY?..oh 
wait...they didn't pass a law anyway. And if the government would go to 
that great length to close a loophole in pre existing policy illegally, 
they could do it many other ways that would be far simpler and more 
effective. There is just nothing about the hoax theory that ever made any 
sense at all. And yet in light of absolute evidence to the contrary, there 
will still be those (at least here in YouTubeland) who will desperately try 
to cling to their fantasy because pretending this horror never happened is 
preferred to accepting the reality that we live in a society where mass 
shootings can and do happen.﻿

+KnowledgeIsGood   Part of the Constitution can be amended.  And let me 
qualify that:  The words can be added to or taken away, but the spirit and 
meaning cannot be abrogated.  The first ten amendments can be 'unamended', 
but not changed.  They merely state openly on the record what 10 of the 
most important inalienable rights of the people are.  Does that make 
sense?  Being an 'amendment' doesn't 'create' the right:  The rights are 
merely being recognized, not created.  The right was already in existence, 
even before the Constitution, but the founders included them to openly put 
the government on notice that the People have rights, these first ten 
amendments being the foremost, which the government owes it's sole 
existence to protecting.  So, the right can neither be created or altered, 
nor is it created or altered, although the 'description' of it or listing 
of it may be subject to amendment.  Here I am only speaking on the first 
ten amendments.  But there are other parts that are similar.  For instance, 
to amend away the guarantee of a republican form of government would 
substantially and effectively 'ruin' the entire proposition and function of 
the Constitution and government.

My theory is that this school was selected because it was nearing closure 
or was "unofficially" closed to the uninvolved public due to its 
dilapidated state. As a former VPK teacher I can tell you that the state 
inspects facilities where children dwell with a fine tooth comb. You would 
laugh at some of the things we were dinged for by the Florida Department of 
Children and Families in our brand new preschool. The previous attending 
families of the non-involved public who attended Sandy Hook sometime maybe 
around 2008 (although I think, as VPK teacher of 6 years that, judging by 
the outdated furniture and tattered educational materials, this school 
hadnt had a single penny put into it since the early-mid 90s) were moved 
into their new school, and the fake families/actors moved in shortly before 
"the event". Its not an unreasonable theory, as the "debunkers" (who are 
the ones who are starting to look like maniacs at this point, for believing 
all this laughable bully ninny) have a valid point, you couldnt have a 
school be 100% closed down without SOMEONE noticing. There is a closed down 
elementary school near my house that I attended in the 90s, it was briefly 
used after its closure as an K-5th elementary school as an overflow campus 
for freshman classes from the high school. The high school was in the 
process of being expanded so this closed down school was useful to the 
district. Sandy Hook could have had some weird mixed use that worked 
perfect for staging it as actually operating or being used... Not hard to 
do and quite clever..Dont forget, this was supposed to be an affluent 
community and you expect us to believe this is the type of school upper 
class people would send their children to? Looks so low-tech and very 
outdated. with those types of property taxes I would expect more 
maintenance or at least routine replacement of the carpets and 
linoleum...Just a thought! Keep up the investigative work.﻿
